message_1: Given an encoded message using Vigenere cipher with a key length of 6 characters, where the first 6 characters of the key are "MATHST", decode the message "UWNAJTZVZKWM".
message_2:
To decode the message "UWNAJTZVZKWM" using the Vigenere cipher with the key "MATHST", we need to reverse the encryption process. The Vigenere cipher works by shifting each letter in the plaintext by a certain number of positions, determined by the corresponding letter in the key. The reverse process involves shifting each letter in the ciphertext back by the same number of positions.

First, we need to convert the key "MATHST" into numerical values, where A=0, B=1, C=2, ..., Z=25:

M = 12
A = 0
T = 19
H = 7
S = 18
T = 19

Now, we will reverse the Vigenere cipher by shifting each letter in the ciphertext back by the corresponding key value:

U (20) - M (12) = I (8)
W (22) - A (0) = W (22)
N (13) - T (19) = E (4)
A (0) - H (7) = T (19)
J (9) - S (18) = R (17)
T (19) - T (19) = A (0)

Z (25) - M (12) = N (13)
V (21) - A (0) = V (21)
Z (25) - T (19) = E (4)
K (10) - H (7) = D (3)
W (22) - S (18) = I (8)
M (12) - T (19) = N (13)

The decoded message is "IWETRANVEDIN".
